dataset_names.description: List of dataset names. We want to unlearn wmdp-bio while retaining knowledge in other datasets
dataset_names.title: Dataset Names

intervention_method.description: Intervention method. We only support 'clamp_feature_activation' for now
intervention_method.title: Intervention Method

retain_thresholds.description: We ignore features that activate more than this threshold on the retain dataset
retain_thresholds.title: Retain Thresholds

n_features_list.description: Each N is the number of features we select and clamp to a negative value
n_features_list.title: N Features List

multipliers.description: A list of negative values. We iterate over this list, clamping the selected features to each value
multipliers.title: Multipliers

mcq_batch_size.description: MCQ batch size. Multiple choice questions are shorter, so we can afford a larger batch size
mcq_batch_size.title: MCQ Batch Size

dataset_size.description: Dataset size we use when calculating feature sparsity
dataset_size.title: Dataset Size

seq_len.description: Sequence length when calculating feature sparsity
seq_len.title: Sequence Length

n_batch_loss_added.description: Number of batches to use when calculating the loss added by an intervention (currently not supported).
n_batch_loss_added.title: N Batch Loss Added

target_metric.description: Controls the type of `question_ids` we load. We support 'correct', `correct-iff-question`, and `correct-no-tricks
target_metric.title: Target Metric

save_metrics.description: If true, we save the metrics for each set of intervention hyperparameters. This is required to be true currently, as the unlearning score is calculated over all results.
save_metrics.title: Save Metrics Flag

model_name.description: Model name. Note that this should be a instruct model.
model_name.title: Model Name

unlearning_score.description: Unlearning score, using methodology from APPLYING SPARSE AUTOENCODERS TO UNLEARN KNOWLEDGE IN LANGUAGE MODELS
unlearning_score.title: Unlearning Score

description: An evaluation of the ability of SAEs to unlearn biology knowledge from LLMs, using methodology from `Applying Sparse Autoencoders to Unlearn Knowledge in Language Models`

eval_id.description: A unique UUID identifying this specific eval run
eval_id.title: ID

datetime_epoch_millis.description: The datetime of the evaluation in epoch milliseconds
datetime_epoch_millis.title: DateTime (epoch ms)

eval_result_metrics.description: The metrics of the evaluation, organized by category. Define your own categories and the metrics that go inside them.
eval_result_metrics.title: Result Metrics Categorized

eval_result_details.description: Optional. The details of the evaluation. A list of objects that stores nested or more detailed data, such as details about the absorption of each letter.
eval_result_details.title: Result Details

sae_bench_commit_hash.description: The commit hash of the SAE Bench that ran the evaluation.
sae_bench_commit_hash.title: SAE Bench Commit Hash

sae_lens_id.description: The ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_id.title: SAE Lens ID

sae_lens_release_id.description: The release ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_release_id.title: SAE Lens Release ID

sae_lens_version.description: The version of SAE Lens that ran the evaluation.
sae_lens_version.title: SAE Lens Version

eval_result_unstructured.description: Optional. Any additional outputs that don't fit into the structured eval_result_metrics or eval_result_details fields. Since these are unstructured, don't expect this to be easily renderable in UIs, or contain any titles or descriptions.
eval_result_unstructured.title: Unstructured Results

title: Unlearning
